submission:
class Solution:
    def countOfPairs(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        n = len(nums)
        b = nums[0]
        for i in range(n-1):
            if nums[i+1] - nums[i] < 0:
                b = max(b - (nums[i] - nums[i+1]), -1)
        # dp = [0] * b
        # prefix = [0] * b
        mod = int(1e9+7)
        # for j in range(min(b, nums[-1])):
        #     dp[j] = j + 1
        #     prefix[j] = j * (j + 1) // 2
        # print(dp)
        # for i in range(n - 1):
        #     dp = [0] * b
        #     spend = min(0, nums[i+1] - nums[i])
        #     for j in range(min(b, nums[-1]) - spend):
        #         dp[j+spend] = prefix[j]
        #         # MOD
        #     prefix[0] = prefix[-1] = 0
        #     for j in range(b):
        #         prefix[j] = prefix[j-1] + dp[j]
        #     print(dp)
        # return 0
        if b == -1:
            return 0
        binom = 1
        ans = 1
        # print(n, b)
        for i in range(n, n + b):
            binom = binom * i // (i - n + 1)
            # print(binom)
            ans = (ans + binom) % mod
        return ans
